input_text:
Job Title: MATERIAL HANDLER I

Location: Fuquay-Varina, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world. 

Job Overview

TE Connectivity's Shipping & Receiving Teams perform a combination of manual and clerical shipping and receiving duties. They use computer systems for tracking, logging, verifying and reporting incoming and outgoing shipments. They follow shipping practices and procedures, transportation routing, schedules and requirements. The Shipping & Receiving Teams receive incoming materials and prepare materials for shipment. They process freight bills, packing sheets, and other documents. They also route merchandise to destinations.

Packaging and Receiving as required. Must stage material in designated areas or place in racks as required.Prepares outgoing materials for shipping. Completes required paperwork to accompany outgoing materials such as packing slips and intercompany proforma shipping sheets.Help maintain inventory in the warehouse by completing bin audits and investigating variances.General housekeeping of the work area.Counts of Inventory Materials Inventory AccuracyHandle and transport fragile items from shelf to shelf and ensure every item is placed in the assigned locationReceive incoming material in stores locations and SAP (ERP) warehouse management systemResponsible for the accurate transactions of materials in the ERP system.Replenishment of stores locations daily, operating a manual floor lift truck to move palletsPull finished goods items for shipping, provide backup support for each other and for assigned areasInvestigate variances and report material discrepancies.Other duties as assigned.

Shift: Monday to Friday 8 am to 5 pm with overtime as needed

This position requires access to information which is subject to stringent controls under the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or Export Administration Regulations (EAR). Applicants must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. lawful permanent resident, person granted asylee status in the U.S., or person admitted into the U.S. as a refugee.

What Your Background Should Look Like

HS degree or GEDStrong keyboarding and computer skillsGood communication skillsStrong Math skillsExperience using SAP is a plusAbility to multitask and prioritize work to successfully accomplish job dutiesSchedule FlexibilityPrior experience in a manufacturing environment preferredMust be proficient in the English language1 to 2 years experience preferred. 

Competencies

Values: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, Teamwork

About Te Connectivity

TE Connectivity is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next-generation transportation, renewable energy, automated factories, data centers, medical technology and more. With more than 85,000 employees, including 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries. TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at

Compensation

 Competitive base salary commensurate with experience:$33,120 â€“ $49,680 (subject to change dependent on physical location) Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity. Total Compensation = Base Salary + Incentive(s) + Benefits

Benefits

 A comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, 401(k), disability, life insurance, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and voluntary benefits.

EOE, Including Disability/Vets

Experience Level (if available): Associate
